name: Magic: The Gathering Phases and Steps

Beginning Phase.val: The active player untaps the permanents they control. The active player doesn't receive priority.
Complete any actions or pay any costs that occur during upkeep. The active player receives priority now.
The active player draws a card for the turn. This does not use the stack.

Precombat Main Phase.val: The active player may play a land (if one hasn't been played this turn), play spells (the opponent may use abilities and instants in response). Lasts until neither player wants to use a spell or ability (i.e. the stack is empty and all players pass priority).

Combat Phase.val: Play instants or activate abilities. The active player declares which player will be attacked.
The active player declares whether a creature will attack an opponent or their planeswalker.
Opponents declare what creatures will be blocked and abilities/instants can be played in response.
The active player and defending player declare how combat damage will be assigned. An additional combat step is used for creatures with first or double strike.
Triggers occurring at the end of combat are put on to the stack and the active player receives priority.

Postcombat Main Phase.val: The active player may play a land (if one hasn't been played this turn), play spells (the opponent may use abilities and instants in response). Lasts until neither player wants to use a spell or ability (i.e. the stack is empty and all players pass priority).

Ending Phase.val: Triggers occurring during the end step are put on to the stack and the active player receives priority for the last time in a turn.
The active player reduces their hand to 7 cards or less, removes marked damage from all permanents, then passes the turn. No player receisves priority.
